intro: Ceropegia mcloughlinii, commonly known as the silver leaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and small, waxy leaves. The plant produces delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in rocky gardens.
